Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Not using metric identifier to get metric object." (#9082) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes an issue introduced by #8906 

The `metricNamespace` specified in the code overridden the one specified in the configuration and we ended up with metrics reported to the wrong location. This change fixes it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Not using metric identifier to get metric object." (#9082) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The `metricNamespace` specified in the code overridden the one specified in the configuration and we ended up with metrics reported to the wrong location. This change fixes it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Dapper_Release Notes_ScreenReader: On tab navigation to the link under 'Release Notes' tab, NVDA announces the link as the https reference" (#9061) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468978

**Actual:**
On tab navigation to the link under 'Release Notes' tab, NVDA announces the link as the https reference
Similar issue is also observed in JAWS
Similar issue is observed in through out the application.

**Expected:**
The name of the link should be descriptive it should have a name that tell its destination point

**User Impact:**
Screen readers users will face difficulty if link is not announced descriptively.

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: [https://www.nuget.org/packages/Dapper/](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https:%2f%2fwww.nuget.org%2f&data=04%7c01%7cv-prajadhav%40microsoft.com%7cf2a4ca1fba7e473d451608d9a59e03f4%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c637722920825871875%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c1000&sdata=OWWbKuc497S8l6rMh9v0D4GOq3rSkwlcss0RW8CyFkk%3D&reserved=0)
2. "Dapper" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Release Notes' tab controls and press enter to select it.
4. Run the NVDA
5. Check that screen reader is announcing the link inside 'Release Notes' tab.

### Expected Behavior

The name of the link should be descriptive it should have a name that tell its destination point

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Microsoft.Identity.Client_ScreenReader:When we tab to the NuGet packages' table and GitHub repositories table the screen reader is not announcing the column headers name when its read the cell data" (#9048) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468943

**Actual:**
When we tab to the NuGet packages' table and GitHub repositories table and move to each cell the column header of the respective cell is not read
Similar issue is also observed in JAWS
Similar issue is observed in throughout the application

**Expected:**
Each cell should be read with its name row column number and the column header name it belongs too.

**User Impact:**
Screen readers users will face difficulty in knowing the column header reference of the cell

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/coverlet.msbuild/
2. "Microsoft.Identity.Client" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Used by' tab controls and press enter to select it.
4. Tab to 'NuGet packages' table.
5. Run the NVDA
6. tab to the cells of the table   

### Expected Behavior

Each cell should be read with its name row column number and the column header name it belongs too.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Account_ForgotPassword_Keyboard :Invisible content receives focus when user tries to navigate to send button after 'Email' edit field using tab key." (#9052) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468987

**Actual:**
Invisible content receives focus  when the user tries to navigate to send button after 'Email' edit field using tab key.

**Expected:**
There tab focus from edit field should move to  send button on using tab key, Invisible content should not receive focus.

**User Impact:**
Keyboard users will receive correct focus order 

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/account/ForgotPassword
2. "Forgot Password" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Email' edit field and fill it.
4. Tab to send button and observe it.

### Expected Behavior

There tab focus from edit field should move to send button on using tab key, Invisible content should not receive focus.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_coverlet.msbuild_Tab Navigation_Keyboard : Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists are navigated using tab key instead of arrow key." (#9068) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468923

**Actual:**
Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists are navigated using tab key instead of arrow key.
On using tab to a "tab" item the focus on next tab key moves to the next item rather then the data under it
Similar issue is observed for the tab list including 'Readme' , 'Dependencies' , 'Used by' and 'Version'.
Similar issue is observed in through out the application.

**Expected:**
Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists should be navigated using arrow key instead of tab key and when focus is on a tab item the tab key focus should go inside the data under that tab item.
arrow keys should be used for navigation between tab items and tab key for the data under the tabs

**User Impact:**
Keyboard users will not be able to access the data under tabs immediately 

### Repro Steps

1.  Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/coverlet.msbuild/
2.  "coverlet.msbuild" page will get open.
3.  Tab to Tab navigation controls.
4.  Tab to Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists and observe it.

### Expected Behavior

Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists should be navigated using arrow key instead of tab key and when focus is on a tab item the tab key focus should go inside the data under that tab item.
arrow keys should be used for navigation between tab items and tab key for the data under the tabs

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Made Package Details page's tabs navigable with left/right arrow keys" (#9077) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/9068

**Problem:**
 
On the Package Details page, tabs are navigated between using the tab key, rather than the left and right arrow keys, as it is supposed to be. This means that once a user has selected a tab, they must still tab navigate through the remaining inactive tabs before they can access the tab content.

**Previously,**
![20220325_182528](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/160219270-24b3d6af-42ae-484e-a867-cbae22dbc822.gif)

**Fix:**

I added an event listener for left and right arrow keys, and changed the tab in focus based on the input. I used keyUp as the trigger here rather than keyDown, because adding an event listener for keyDown also messed with other keyboard functionality (eg. 'tab' and 'enter' keys) when focused on the tab element.

To enable this, I also made it such that only the selected/expanded tab has _tabindex="0"_ and receives tab focus sequentially with other elements on the page, while all inactive tabs have _tabindex="-1"_, and can only receive focus when using left/right arrow keys from their active sibling tab. Once a new tab is made active, we set _tabindex="-1"_ on the previous tab, and _tabindex="0"_ on the new active tab.

**After the changes,**
![20220325_181409](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/160219028-f8bd7c95-7efc-410a-8d32-3140726d749d.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y]Enable dismissing Verified tooltip with esc" (#9074) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently, when navigated to by keyboard, the verified tooltip cannot be dismissed without tabbing away from the icon.
This change enables dismissing this tooltip by usage of the esc key for all locations where this tooltip is used.

As a bonus it also fixes a bug that could cause the tooltip to stop working altogether when clicked on.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Reduce the amount of magic numbers in JS code in Gallery" (#9078) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Gallery JS code is ridden with magic numbers:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/common.js#L12

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/common.js#L244

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/common.js#L574-L578

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/autocomplete.js#L64-L67

etc.

For better code readability it would be nice to provide nice names at least for some of them (key codes, for example). Some attempts to do it seems to have been done in the past, we need to extend it:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/autocomplete.js#L3-L13

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: MsBuild version is not parsed correctly when -MsBuildPath option is passed to nuget.exe restore" (#11689) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

nuget.exe

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

NuGet.exe version 4.8.2 and above passes `RestoreBuildInParallel="False" and RestoreUseSkipNonexistentTargets="False"` to `msbuild.exe` only when the tool set version is less than `15.5`

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/60927d634f10ccecb76f0596f3dcfe6a31d97de9/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/MsBuildUtility.cs#L270-L278

`nuget.exe restore` command accepts `-MSBuildPath` option to specify the path of MSBuild to use with the command. This option precedes over `-MSBuildVersion` option. If `-MSBuildPath` is passed, then https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/MsBuildUtility.cs#L839 line of code invokes https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/60927d634f10ccecb76f0596f3dcfe6a31d97de9/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/MsBuildToolset.cs#L27-L31 constructor but it fails to identify the version of msbuild from the path argument like other constructors. This results in `ParsedVersion` property returning `0.0` default version. Hence `nuget.exe` set `RestoreBuildInParallel="False" and RestoreUseSkipNonexistentTargets="False"` always when `-MsBuildPath` option is passed to the restore command.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: `<GeneratePackageOnBuild>true` causes `dotnet pack` to fail when bin folder is missing" (#11691) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

.NET SDK (reflecting any global.json):  Version:   6.0.200  Commit:    4c30de7899  Runtime Environment:  OS Name:     Windows  OS Version:  10.0.19041  OS Platform: Windows  RID:         win10-x64  Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.200\  Host (useful for support):   Version: 6.0.2   Commit:  839cdfb0ec  .NET SDKs installed:   2.2.401 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]   3.1.404 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]   5.0.101 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]   6.0.200 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]  .NET runtimes installed:   Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.2.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]   Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.2.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]   Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.1.10 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]   Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 5.0.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]   Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]   Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.2.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]   Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.10 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]   Microsoft.NETCore.App 5.0.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]   Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]   Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.1.10 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]   Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 5.0.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]   Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

- Given this dotnet project (no other files are needed)
```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net6.0</TargetFramework>
    <ImplicitUsings>enable</ImplicitUsings>
    <Nullable>enable</Nullable>
    <GeneratePackageOnBuild>true</GeneratePackageOnBuild>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```
- Delete the `bin` folder if it exists.
- Run `dotnet pack`
- Observe this error:
> C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.200\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(221,5): error NU5026: The file 'project_folder\bin\Debug\net6.0\Test.dll' to be packed was not found on disk. [project_folder\Test.csproj]

### Verbose Logs

```shell
https://gist.github.com/snebjorn/232c6890e809ad632b5ac295330f9239
```

Original issue from https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/24318

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "_CleanPackageFiles target fails sporadically when (re)building" (#11710) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/msbuild#7465**
- Please respond to @wouterroos.

---

_From @wouterroos on Monday, March 14, 2022 12:28:54 PM_

<!-- This is a template that helps us provide quicker feedback. Please use any relevant sections and delete anything you don't need. -->

### Issue Description
<!--
* Please include a clear and concise description of the problem.
-->

When rebuilding our 80+ project solutions we sporadically get the following error on the `_CleanPackageFiles` target:

`MSB3061 Unable to delete file "C:\Projects\MyProject\src\MyProject\obj\MyPlatform\Debug\MyProject.MyPlatform.3.0.0-debug.nuspec". Access to the path 'C:\Projects\MyProject\src\MyProject\obj\MyPlatform\Debug\MyProject.MyPlatform.3.0.0-debug.nuspec' is denied.`

This issue happens for seemingly random projects in our solution.

### Steps to Reproduce
<!--
* Include as much of the following as possible:

* A minimal sample project that reproduces the issue.
* Your zipped project.
* IDE / CLI steps to create the project and reproduce the behaviour.
* Your command line invocation

If providing steps to reproduce the issue proves difficult, consider attaching a binlog:
[Details on sharing binary logs](https://aka.ms/msbuild/binlog)
[More information on binary logs](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/main/documentation/wiki/Binary-Log.md)
NOTE: Binary logs capture environment information. Ensure it does not include any information you don't want to be public before you attach one.
If you want to share one just with Microsoft, you can [report a problem through Visual Studio](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/report) and share it privately with Microsoft.
-->

Execute the following MSBuild command until the issue presents itself (Build runs with `Configuration` set to `Debug` and `Platform` set to `any cpu` by default):

`msbuild MySolution.MyPlatform.sln /bl -t:Rebuild -m --restore`

The impacted projects have `IsPackable` and `GeneratePackageOnBuild` set to true and `PackageOutputPath` set to `$(RepositoryRootDirectory)nuget\nupkg\$(Configuration)\`. Furthermore, the projects have `TargetFrameworks` set to `net48;netcoreapp3.1;net6.0`.

The issue can also be reproduced by opening the solution in Visual Studio and rebuilding the solution. This yields more consistent results.

Additional information:

We have multiple solutions targeting the same projects but for a different platform so we use a `Directory.Build.props` file that modifies the following MSBuild variables to allow for everything to compile to a separate output folder (`BuildForPlatform` is set per project or in a nested Directory.Build.props file based on requirements and `MySolutionPlatform` is determined by the solution name):

```
<!-- BEGIN Sets project output paths for platform-specific projects -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(BuildForPlatform)'=='true'">
    <MSBuildProjectExtensionsPath>obj\$(MySolutionPlatform)</MSBuildProjectExtensionsPath>
    <BaseIntermediateOutputPath>obj\$(MySolutionPlatform)\</BaseIntermediateOutputPath>
    <BaseOutputPath>bin\$(MySolutionPlatform)</BaseOutputPath>
    <DefaultItemExcludes>$(DefaultItemExcludes);bin/**;obj/**</DefaultItemExcludes>
    <PackageId>$(MSBuildProjectName).$(MySolutionPlatform)</PackageId>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <!-- END -->
```

We build our solutions in parallel using the `-m` MSBuild switch or by setting `maximum number of parallel project builds` in Visual Studio.

### Expected Behavior
<!--
* The expected output or behavior.
-->

As happens sometimes, the solution will be rebuilt and all NuGet packages are generated as expected.

### Actual Behavior
<!--
* The actual output or behavior.
-->

Rebuilding one of the projects fails with the error mentioned above, causing a cascading failure for all projects depending on the project causing the issue. We've verified this behavior using both Visual Studio and the MSBuild command line. The issue happens more often when building using Visual Studio but we've also seen occurrences when using MSBuild, especially when building on our build server. 

### Analysis
<!--
* If you have an idea where the problem might lie, let us know that here.
* Please include any pointers to code, relevant changes, or related issues you know of.
-->

I generated a `.binlog` file and did some analysis and the issue might be caused by the `_CleanPackageFiles` target running for each target framework during the inner build, which are built in parallel. This seems weird as the `Pack` is only executed once (after all inner builds are completed, which makes sense). I've submitted the binlog as a Visual Studio issue (see: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Binlog-for-https:githubcomdotnetmsb/1691529?entry=myfeedback)

### Versions & Configurations
<!--
* In a Visual Studio developer command prompt, run `msbuild -version` and paste the output here.
* If applicable, include the version of the tool that invokes MSBuild (Visual Studio, dotnet CLI, etc):

* Post any other relevant configuration settings here.
*   OS, architecture, etc.
-->

MSBuild version: `17.1.0.7609`
OS: `Windows 10 Enterprise 21H2`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: A prompt error “cannot access disposed object” prevents solution saving after installing a package from local path" (#11703) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.2.0.132

### Worked before?

Dev\6.2.0.131

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32329.175
NuGet Version: Dev\6.2.0.132
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2

### Repro steps:
1.Only enable one package source which point to local path (have some packages) in the Options->NuGet Package Manager->Package Sources.
2.Create a C# Console App (.NET Core 6.0) project in VS.
3.Right-Click the project in the Solution Explorer window, select ‘Manage NuGet Packages…’ and select the package source (which I set in step1) in the Package source drop-down box.
4.Click “Browse” tab and install a package from the local path.
5.Save the solution and close VS.

### Expected:
The solution can be saved and closed successfully.

### Actual:
A prompt error “cannot access disposed object” prevents solution saving after installing a package from local path as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/160847414-e8cc9efa-e410-4a29-9a87-9b672aa87f38.png)
### Notes:
1.It reproes on .NET SDK style projects, does not repro on .NET Framework projects.
2.It just repro on local path packages, dose not repro on online package source (e.g. nuget.org).
3.It start to repro from Dev\6.2.0.132, doesn't repro on Dev\6.2.0.131.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org" (#61) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: We announced plans to require tFA on all accounts on NuGet.org. Details in the [blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/requiring-two-factor-authentication-on-nuget-org/).
